lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Abe met Senate and Democratic leaders active in trade legislation, telling them of Japan's plan to spur domestic spending by 34 billion dlrs and open its markets to a wide range of goods, including supercomputers and farm products.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: White House spokesman Marlin Fitzwater, asked if Nakasone's visit might help to defuse trade tensions, said "whether progress can be made depends on how you want to measure it."

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: White House and congressional leaders took a wait-and-see stance, after a series of meetings with former Japanese Foreign Minister Shintaro Abe, who was here paving the way for the April 29-May 2 visit of Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone.
